1968848619.given_title: Forbidden Planet robot sets price record for auctioned film prop
1968848619.resolved_title: Forbidden Planet robot sets price record for auctioned film prop
1968848619.excerpt: Bonhams, which held the auction, said the price beat the previous prop record of US$4 million for the 12-inch falcon statue in the Humphrey Bogart classic The Maltese Falcon.  It also topped the US$4.6 million for the white dress worn by Marilyn Monroe in The Seven Year Itch.

892182481.excerpt: The modern version of the toy is practically unrecognizable, an Object Lesson. The man behind me in the queue was trying to be helpful: “It’s true, though, right? They are used as weapons in Asia. I go there a lot and I’ve seen them do it—they’re lethal.

3854610663.resolved_title: Now associated with childhood fun, the swing has a near-universal history of ritual transgression and transformation
3854610663.excerpt: Long before it entered the urban playgrounds of the 20th century, the swing was a ritual instrument of healing, punishment and transformation.

1.caption: Krishna and Rādhā on a swing surrounded by female attendants called gopis

2.caption: Along the River During the Qingming Festival, illustrated in 1737. Courtesy the National Palace Museum, Taiwan

6.caption: Swing figurine, 300-900 CE. Courtesy the Museo de Antropología de Xalapa, Veracruz, Mexico

3677598560.resolved_title: 3D Printing Your Favorite Heroes: Hasbro Does Mass Customization
3677598560.excerpt: Hasbro has announced Hasbro Selfie Series figures—a groundbreaking endeavor to use 3D printing to manufacture personalized action figures at scale. For the first time, fans will be able to scan their face with a smart device and have a custom-made look-a-like action figure delivered to their door.

3647706050.resolved_title: Lifelong Quests! Lawsuits! Feuds! A Super-Serious Story About Cereal.
3647706050.excerpt: Whenever Gabe Fonseca invites someone over to his Los Angeles apartment for the first time, he worries what they’ll think of his cereal box collection. He has over 200 on display in one small room, affixed by magnets to sheet metal on the wall.

2.caption: Thomas Hicks showing off his Froot Loops socks in front of the cereal aisle at the local supermarket in Los Angeles.

3887189821.given_title: Ohio toy store becoming one of the largest in the country
3887189821.resolved_title: Ohio toy store becoming one of the largest in the country
3887189821.excerpt: FAIRFIELD, Ohio — Visiting the toy store as a kid is a nostalgic memory for many- which is why five years ago a few friends sought to create that nostalgic experience for others. Taking a look around The Toy Department, it’s hard not to remember the good old days.

1.caption: Toys like Barbies, Hot Wheels, and G.I. Joe's line the shelves at The Toy Department

2.caption: Koepnick has been with the store since the beginning

3697508236.resolved_title: How Do You Make the Perfect Toy?
3697508236.excerpt: Mifrah Abid’s eight-year-old son, Moosa, loves The Avengers. He’s obsessed with his Iron Man action figure and can talk at length about its many suits. Her twelve-year-old daughter, Tooba, meanwhile, went through a Roblox phase, playing a video game that’s all the rage with kids her age.

3683219248.given_title: The mystery of the world's oldest toys
3683219248.resolved_title: The mystery ancient toys puzzling archaeologists
3683219248.excerpt: Over the two decades that archaeologist Gus Van Beek excavated Tell Jemmeh, an Assyrian settlement inhabited from around 3,800 to 2,200 years ago, he recovered so many objects, it took the Smithsonian 40 years to catalogue them all. There were coins. Scarabs. Amulets.

1.caption: A relief dating to the 9th Century BC in Turkey depicts two men playing with spinning tops

2.caption: Small Ancient Greek jugs like this one from 430 BC, which are called choes, often show children playing

3.credit: Credit: Kerameikos Archaeological Museum in Athens
3.caption: Was this miniature horse on wheels, found in a 2,100-year-old grave, a toy, a funerary offering to the gods, or both?

4.caption: Various female figurines have been found all over the world, including these, dating back 1,500 years, in Israel – but were they meant for children?

5.credit: Credit: Archaeological Museum of Albacete Spain
5.caption: This ivory Ancient Roman doll with articulated arms and legs was found in a 4th-Century child's grave

6.credit: Credit: Maria Sommer/The National Museum of Athens/Hellenic Ministry of Education and Religious Affairs
6.caption: One Ancient Greek stelae shows a child sitting and playing with a ball

7.credit: Credit: Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Antikensammlung/Johannes Laurentius
7.caption: An Ancient Greek vase depicts what looks like today's yo-yo – but probably depicts something else

8.caption: Objects that look, and sound, like rattles, such as this one from Greece 2,500 years ago, date back millennia (Credit: Maria Sommer/Benaki Toys Department, Phaliro, Athens

3767343718.given_title: Why Hot Wheels are one of the most inflation-proof toys in American history
3767343718.resolved_title: Why Hot Wheels are one of the most inflation-proof toys in American history
3767343718.excerpt: Inflation, the curse of our pocketbooks and the Federal Reserve, has hit almost every good in the U.S. But the price of a beloved toy has managed to hover around $1 — for more than 50 years. Hot Wheels are a retail oddity.

3807806700.resolved_title: Magic: The Gathering Becomes a Billion-Dollar Brand for Toymaker Hasbro
3807806700.excerpt: Richard Neal has been playing Magic: The Gathering, a fantasy card game, for nearly two decades. Two or three nights a week, he heads to Mox Boarding House, a game store in Bellevue, Wash., wielding a deck he has painstakingly built over the years.
